sentences:
A'isha bint Talhah ( ) was , according to a Sunni source , the daughter of the prominent Muslim general Talha ibn Ubayd - Allah and Umm Kulthum bint Abu Bakr .
Umm Kulthum was the daughter of the first Sunni Caliph , Abu Bakr .
Her first husband was her cousin , Abdullah ibn Abdulrahman ibn Abi Bakr .
She then married Musab ibn Al - Zubayr al - Asadi , governor of Basra , who was killed .
Her third husband was Umar ibn Ubaydullah al - Taymi .
The following words are attributed to her about veil , widely recognized dress code for women in Islam .
" Since the Almighty hath put on me the stamp of beauty , it is my wish that the public should view the beauty and thereby recognized His grace unto them .
On no account , therefore , will I veil myself .
"
